newsitem.title: UK: UK says ready to host Nazi gold conference.
newsitem.headline: UK says ready to host Nazi gold conference.

text.p: Britain said on Tuesday it was ready to host an international conference on what to do about reserves of Nazi gold looted from victims during World War Two.

"I am announcing today that the British government is ready to host an international conference on Nazi gold. The Foreign Office will now consult organisations in the UK and other governments about how best to take this forward," Foreign Secretary Robin Cook said in a statement.
The British Foreign Office released a memorandum which it said provided important information about the gold stolen from individuals as well as from governments during the war.

Britain, France and the United States have formed a joint commission in a bid to resolve the problem of millions of dollars of gold which the Nazis seized from Jews, some of which has been languishing in Swiss bank accounts since the war.
Details of the conference were to be announced later.
In March the Labour Party, then in opposition, pledged to call a conference of countries that handle Nazi gold to discuss compensation for Holocaust survivors if it won power in the May 1 election.
